Add crypto acceptance to your website (non-custodial solution, self serve)
Ask HN: Avid book readers and, XR users and enthusiasts
text:
When studying a subject, what is more impactful in understanding and retaining for longer term what is being learnt: learning by reading textbooks or learning by using visual media like VR/AR?

Intuitively it feels like visual aid used for explaining a concept could be more helpful, but getting that "aha" moment when understanding a concept by reading could help retain that information for longer period.

Anyone has experience in this area or know of any research done on this topic?

I am trying to understand what will be more helpful to students, understanding a subject by reading textbooks or understanding it by using visual media like XR.

title: Higher Rates Will Lead to the Next Generation of Great Tech Startups
Smartphone Shipments Suffer the Largest-Ever Decline
GitHub: Reaching a Milestone of 100M Devs
Want to start a crowdshipping on-demand same day delivery
text:
Alright, building a website for on-demand delivery for goods from the corner bodega and store all over NYC. Similar to Instacart.

Anyone knows how I can legally have ordinary people with cars to deliver goods? I use to be an Instacart driver on 2016. It was straight forward process and got hired quickly.

Things have changed now, I read that Independent drivers now need to be employees. Whats the deal here? I have no funds to pay hourly.

Worth getting into this niche or do I seriously need to start pitching for funds?

As a new startup can I legally hire drivers to deliver goods as independent contractors?

I don't see why I should pay for a lawyer to do all of this answering since it's such a simple business model and don't even have customers yet, but if I need to then I guess I would.

Just want to know all of these things rather than sticking my head in the ground like an ostrich. Anyone got experience in this type of startup and how to go about it?

Thanks.

title: Ask HN: How to get people to buy/try my SaaS? [basic MVP done]
text:
I'm working on a process management software and I'm in the initial stages where I have a bare bones MVP ready.

I have talked to a few people in the industry (a small manufacturing firm, couple of botique software firms) who liked the solution I'm proposing. I started working on it the start of this year, and now that I've built the MVP (super alpha version if you can call it that) on my own I want to get these people and others to try it out and give me some feedback.

How do I go about this?
